author: Special Correspondent
text:
To highlight the issue through street plays also

Makkal Adhikaram, an organisation fighting for the closure of Tasmac outlets across the State, will organise an anti-liquor conference here on February 14 to demand closure of liquor shops. It has extended invitation to all sections of the society including college students who wished the closure of liquor shops.

Speaking to media here on Tuesday, its State coordinator C. Raju said the organisation had been carrying out a sustained campaign and organising protests across the State keeping this issue in the forefront. The government was well aware of the fact that liquor affected lives of several families. Still, it was against the idea of closure of liquor shops.

Although the government had eradicated illicit brew, it was not keen on closing liquor shops, he alleged.
title: Anti-liquor meet in Tiruchi on February 14
